intro: Veronica teucrium, commonly known as mouse-ear hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Veronica teucrium is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for various ailments.
